sentence.text: RAB3A interacting protein (protein targeting to membrane) has been determined to be involved in cancer progression; however, its expression pattern and function in gastric cancer remain unknown.
The aim of this study was to determine the association between protein targeting to membrane and gastric cancer, in addition to its functional role in this disease.
In addition, we verified the co-expression of and interplay between protein targeting to membrane and SSX2 during gastric cancer progression.
Thus, these findings elucidated the central role of protein targeting to membrane in inducing an invasive phenotype in gastric cancer cells, in addition to its involvement in cytokine production.
